alert.note: Alert for Henry (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 09 at 6:31PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Henry County in southeastern Alabama, Clay, southwestern Randolph, northwestern Calhoun and northwestern Early Counties in southwestern Georgia through 800 PM EDT/700 PM CDT/... At 731 PM EDT/631 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Cuthbert to near Fort Gaines. Movement was east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Fort Gaines, Blakely, Edison, Bellville, Bluffton, Shorterville, Walter F. George Lock And Dam, Parksville, Carnegie, Hayes, Pecan, Randolph Co A/p, Jones Crossing, Bethel, Suttons Corner, Fort Gaines-Clay Airport, Harrisons Mill, Hardwickburg, Zetto and Moye. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
